This film, which is about a heart transplant, brings out the desperation of the patient for whom …

posts._title: Marguerite Duras – Marguerite Duras: Worn out with Desire…to Write (1985)
posts.title: Marguerite Duras: Worn out with Desire…to Write
posts.excerpt: Quote: She was the sort of woman who spared neither herself nor others—and arguably qualifies as 20th-century France’s greatest femme de lettres. In this interview, the late novelist and filmmaker talks openly about the hardship and the romance of her childhood in French Indochina, sharing how this period haunted her life and shaped her work. …

posts._title: Matthias Glasner – Der Freie Wille AKA The Free Will (2006)
posts.title: Der Freie Wille
posts.excerpt: AMG: Theo (Jürgen Vogel) has raped several women and is, after several years of committing acts of sexual violence, caught. He is committed to a psychiatric prison and, after 12 years in prison, he is released to return to normal life. Theo finds work as a printer, goes regularly to therapy, and lives in a …

posts.title: Osama
posts.excerpt: The movies are a little more than a century old. Imagine if we could see films from previous centuries — records of slavery, the Great Fire of London, the Black Plague. “Osama” is like a film from some long-ago age. Although it takes place in Afghanistan, it documents practices so cruel that it is hard …

posts._title: Marc Rothemund – Sophie Scholl – Die letzten Tage AKA Sophie Scholl: The Final Days (2005)
posts.title: Sophie Scholl – Die letzten Tage
posts.excerpt: Sophia Magdalena Scholl (May 9, 1921 – February 22, 1943) was a prominent member of the White Rose non-violent resistance movement in Nazi Germany. She was convicted of treason after having been found distributing anti-war leaflets at the University of Munich with her brother Hans. As a result, they were both executed by guillotine. Since …

posts._title: Cãtãlin Mitulescu – Dincolo de calea feratã AKA By The Rails (2016)
posts.title: Dincolo de calea feratã
posts.excerpt: Radu has come back from Italy after an year and finds his wife totally changed. They spend the night trying to rediscover their selves. The distance has created distrust and confusion between them but Radu hopes for a new beginning. Music resounds beyond the railroad. The night was never that long.

posts.title: Gimme Danger
posts.excerpt: An in-depth look at the legendary punk band, The Stooges.

posts._title: Anna Muylaert – Mãe Só Há Uma AKA Don’t Call Me Son (2016)
posts.title: Mãe Só Há Uma
posts.excerpt: Quote: Most films—especially taut, lower-budgeted indies—choose one theme or dramatic premise and run with it. Others cross-wire two potent and ostensibly unrelated ideas and bask in the sparks they generate. The terrifically assured and engrossing Brazilian film “Don’t Call Me Son” is a great example of the latter breed. On the one hand, writer/director Anna …

posts.title: Fai bei sogni
posts.excerpt: Massimo’s idyllic childhood is shattered by the death of his mother. Years later, he is forced to relive his traumatic past and compassionate doctor Elisa could help him open up and confront his childhood wounds.
